correspAction.name: the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia, Queensland Branch

head.supplied: [Included in the correspondence read was a telegram from Baron von Mueller, offering his valedictory homage to his Excellency after having continued in Australia his long and brilliant career.]...

p.seg: To the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia, Queensland Branch

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Telegram not found. The text given here is from 'Royal Geographical Society, Paper by the Governor', a report of the meeting of the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia, Queensland Branch, held on 25 October 1895, in Brisbane courier, 28 October 1895, p. 3. The meeting included a farewell to the retiring Governor, who presented a paper on Captain James Cook's first Pacific voyage, prompted by a remark in a Sydney newspaper that the memorial to Cook in Hawaii was 'an unworthy memorial to a not particularly deserving hero'.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 9pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.1665in;

note.p: M's telegram is dated to the day of the meeting as this was his frequent practice on similar occasions.

p.seg: [Included in the correspondence read was a telegram from Baron von Mueller, offering his valedictory homage to his Excellency after having continued in Australia his long and brilliant career.]
